title: Understanding Analysis Types
text: In analytical chemistry, different types of analyses are used to determine the composition of a substance. These include qualitative, quantitative, and characterization analyses.

title: Qualitative vs. Quantitative Analysis
text: Qualitative analysis identifies the presence of certain chemicals, while quantitative analysis measures the amount of these chemicals.

title: Characterization Analysis
text: Characterization analysis provides detailed information about the structure and properties of a substance, but not necessarily its chemical composition.

title: Choosing the Right Analysis
text: To ensure a product is free from harmful chemicals, which type of analysis would you choose?
